Reviews.Title: “Won't stay again!”
Reviews.Author: Angi R
Reviews.Content: I will start with the fact that we found a bed bug in one of our rooms. We were told the manager Austin would call us on Monday at the latest and still haven't heard from him. Grateful we found it before we left so we could take precautions which were quite extensive. We had a toilet back up in another room and it took 4 trips to the front desk (which we couldn't call because phone in room didn't work) to get it semi-cleaned up. The heating and air was turned off for the night due to a water leak. And for those that don't stay...The bottom of the "kiddie" pool is covered with brown stains. The sitting area smells like urine and the upstairs snack area was extremely hot. The upside to our experience was the staff was very courteous and we were given free breakfast buffet for the heat and air being turned off. Although be warned. Toast will cost you extra! Very disappointed! Especially since manager has not bothered to call us back!

Reviews.Title: “Are you serious? 11p 1”
Reviews.Author: msditty
Reviews.Content: My husband & I have been coming to this hotel since we were kids. We have brought our children here since they opened the Cove a few times. The hotel is maintained and clean, the cove is well staffed w/ lifeguards and plenty of fun facilities w/ the kids. You can get a waterpark package through the hotel w/ 4 wristbands per day, extra's will cost you $15. They now allow outside use of the park, which is kind of a downside, people can buy day passes that aren't hotel guests. The rooms are well kept and clean, there are not fridges or microwaves in the rooms. If you have not stayed here this hotel is built around an indoor atrium that has the pool, spa, pool tables, putt putt, bar/snack bar, and common seating areas. The balconies overlook the atrium which is the or should I say was the plus side to stay here. Now the Are you serious......they close the pool area down at 11p on weekends which I understand due to noise, however they now say the entire atrium is closed at 11p which means the common areas adults were "ran out of" from this older lady who had an authority complex. Grown adults were playing cards and were told they had to leave,. My husband was told he couldn't sit there w/ his computer he had to "go to his room". Are you serious? We have never experienced this in the past, It was like camp "lights out at 11p". Not only did Ms, Authority complex run ADULTS off from the atrium area, she wouldn't allow you to walk thru it to other locations to the hotel. THEN, she came through and started telling people they were not allowed to sit on their balconies? ARE YOU SERIOUS? I paid GOOD $$$$$ to stay here and now I am being dictated to were I can go in the hotel and I can't sit on my balcony? Not only was this ridiculous but the woman was rude, overbearing, and needed an attitude adjustment. Needless to say, we will NOT go back. I do not pay for a hotel to tell me when I must go to bed.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: leezocat
Reviews.Content: Hotel is outdated and cold. Rooms are ok - our toilet didn't flush. We asked for addt towels; none were brought. Carpeting throughout building is disgusting. Water park is fun. The hot tubs are lukewarm, and so much chlorine that most people can't stand it. Air temp and wat3er temps are chilly. Seating is gross and cheap looking. Went to breakfast downstairs. Buffett was sad, but at $10 per adult and free kids, it was a decent value. Most staff are pleasant. At $200+ per night, my family will not be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Good place for smaller kids”
Reviews.Author: Shalloh60
Reviews.Content: We celebrated our daughters birthday here and took our grandkids with us. They are 3, 5, and 7. It's a small water park, but young for small kids. The rooms were nice, beds comfy. The staff was very nice. Would go back again. There are lots of good restaurants close by. Easy to find, right off the high way. We used a Plum District special, so it was worth the money we spent.

Reviews.Title: “Mid-winter get-away, nice to splash, but only so-so”
Reviews.Author: BluegrassJayhawk
Reviews.Content: We went to the Carribean Cove over President's Day holiday in 2009 or so. We had an okay time. The water park was nice enough, the room was nice enough, but nothing really popped as being special. The weather outside was very, very cold (highs in the teens) at the time that we were there, which shouldn't matter, but the hallway that you needed to walk down to get to the waterpark had an exterior door which made the hallway much too cold. Also, at least one of the slides goes outside the building, and it wasn't uncomfortably cold, but I didn't want to ride it again.

Reviews.Title: “Birthday stay :(”
Reviews.Author: lori M
Reviews.Content: I took my son on Jan. 3rd for his 9th birthday. We arrived around 6 thinking we had till 9 and all day the next day. The water park closed early at 7PM because of low attendance. That is NOT right!! PLUS the regular pool was closed by the health department...... That is what the orange sign on the gate said. The web sight said the water park closed at 9 pm. So my son missed out on his birthday and the water park did not do what it advertised. Call the front desk before arriving to find out what time the water park closes because they close when ever they feel like it. ONE LAST BEEF. The phone in the room did not work. :( needs a good makeover!!!

Reviews.Title: “Unhappy Stay”
Reviews.Author: Ann B
Reviews.Content: We went to Caribbean Cove this past weekend, the water park was nice and the kids enjoyed it, the only problem I saw was that lieguards were texting while they should have been watching the water and the guests, I do not think they should be allowed to have cell phones while working. The other issue that I had was in the Cafe, not only were they very slow, but we had people sitting behind us who were very rude and kept spitting beer through a straw onto everything, the kids were almost done eating when I finally got my food, then had a beer shower, thanks to the annoying guest in the next booth. I did not get what I ordered, but for fear it taking another 1 hour, I ate it the way it was brought, the kids had just ordered refills on their drinks when we get our "beer shower" so they were wasted along with their food that was also in the shower range. You could not see out the windows in the room, not enough towels and kids that run the halls all hours of the night. I hope people that are here for the Super Bowl have a much better experience!

Reviews.Title: “Don't go! Quite undesirable.”
Reviews.Author: Livetotravelx12
Reviews.Content: My family and I decided to visit the Caribbean Cove for an overnight stay. I booked a room through the front desk and when I arrived the front desk gave me a room next to the entrance near the park. No wireless as advertised, no sofa as booked, and not a quiet comfortable stay at all. The walls are paper thin and you can hear everything outside the room and above you. The room was quite outdated for the price no working phone and an old hazy cathode TV and everything seemed dirty and infested. I would recommend not staying in the hotel if coming for the waterpark. The waterpark is great for the kids and situated to allow a parent to conveniently observe all the action but over rated.... Not a place to visit or revisit. Save your money.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy rooms, run down...and a bed bug.”
Reviews.Author: ejshepherd
Reviews.Content: This hotel is extremely run down and filthy. The room just felt dirty. The curtains had stains all over them, my toddler found all kinds of disgusting things on the floor (cheez it, trash), mold in the tub, run down ceiling in the bathroom. It was just gross. We came to Caribbean Cove with my in-laws and we had 3 rooms total. We were in the room next to me when I saw a bug next to my head on the curtain... my mother in law brought it to the front desk and sure enough it was a bed bug! Gross! They had told her they just sprayed for them, but my in-laws should switch rooms. After hearing it was a bed bug, there was NO way my kids were sleeping another night there. The management was very nice about refunding our second night and even gave us complimentary passes to the water park for the following day. We didn't end up using them, I really had no desire to go back in the building. This place needs an OVERHAUL! We had a really crummy room location too.... it was centrally located which is nice, but it was internal (sliding patio door to holidome pool) and we had no window to the outside. There was also a TON of traffic around our room going to both the pool, and water park. People were often sitting on chairs right outside our sliding door as well. Every time the elevator would arrive there was an audible "ding" in our room that drove me crazy all night. The beds and pillows were horribly uncomfortable. For reference, we were in room 148, and my in-laws (where we found the bug) were in room 150. No plans to come back, and I kind of think both nights should have been comped, honestly, but we didn't ask so I can't fairly speak to that.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Tom E
Reviews.Content: I stopped in Indianapolis on business and wanted to book @ Holiday Inn that I have visited before. The hotel is no longer a Holiday Inn but I stopped anyway. The front desk manager was super nice, check- in was easy and he even gave me a razor and some shaving cream because I forgot to bring them. The sports bar has been updated since my last stay with a paint job and new tvs and no kids. Mark the bartender was great and the food top-notch. I will stay there again even if its not a Holiday Inn and I don't get points.

Reviews.Title: “They suck!”
Reviews.Author: Chi_native33
Reviews.Content: We reserved an over sized room w/2 queen beds, sofa sleeper, microwave and mini fridge (to accommodate our family of 6). When we showed up we were impressed with the nice lobby area until.......... they put us in 2 small room’s w/NO mini fridge, microwave or sofa sleeper. The manager apologized for the inconvenience but didn't take one red penny off the bill. Some of the staff members were very unfriendly, the water pressure in the bathrooms were nearly non- existent and the hot water was luke warm. Don't think I'll take my family back there again, nor would I recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “OK for Family”
Reviews.Author: boboakville
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as the recommended hotel was sold out. The hotel is managed by Holiday Inn as it is a large hotel with lots of rooms. The staff were quite welcoming and helpful and put us in a quiet part of the hotel. Since the hotel has an water park attached, it's probably more for families and not business travelers. My room's air conditioner/heating unit. It was so noisy, I turned it off completely and pulled up the covers. The comfort of the bed was fine - just the noise. The breakfast in the hotel's restaurant was not very good - my colleagues and I left at least half our food on the plate. Make sure you visit the Indy Sports Bar & Grill in the hotel. The folks here are great.

Reviews.Title: “WE HAD BED BUGS!!!!!! DIRTY HOTEL!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ashley R
Reviews.Content: My family and I went for part of a Christmas get together. when we first got there it looked decent but as we started to look through our room, we had stains all over everything. Our curtains looked like someone splattered juice and food all over them. Our family members room had blood stains all over their sheets. I looked over at the pillow on the bed and there was a bug crawling on it. My first thought was "Oh no, I hope that's not a bed bug!" I picked it up with a tissue to get a close look at it, and yep sure enough it was a bed bug!!!! WE FREAKED OUT!!!! We went down to the lobby to tell them, and at first all the manager wanted to do was take care of our breakfast in the morning. Seriously??? That's it??? We refused and so he told us he would give us a $50 credit. We took him up to the room and hanging on my jacket was another bed bug! They then just started to pop up everywhere!!! By that time we were ready to leave and go home but had to make sure we made every precaution not to take these things home with us! They FINALLY told us they would comp us for our room. The staff took all of our clothing and through them in the drying to kill anything that may have been on them. We had to inspect ever item we had before we moved to another room. After we took an hour to inspect everything we moved rooms. (we made them inspect the room we moved to before we moved)- by the time we got our clothes back from the dryer it was 1a.m. We inspected every inch of them and finally got to bed, but of course we couldn't sleep because we felt like bugs were out to get us! The next morning we went to have breakfast at the hotel restaurant. We paid 10.00 a person and the only thing good on the buffet was the bacon. What a waste of money. WE WERE SO DISAPPOINTED WITH EVERYTHING.

Reviews.Title: “What we went for”
Reviews.Author: Lauraloulou12
Reviews.Content: We went to have a nice little family getaway. We took the time to go to the children's museum and enjoy the water park and those both were wonderful! The rooms were not anything fancy. In fact ours smelled a little like smoke, but we had an awesome deal and from reading reviews I wasn't expecting much from the rooms. The breakfast was really nice too. It was in a sit down restaurant and a server came and got you drinks and cleared plates. Make sure you bring cash to tip! If we got another awesome deal like we did before our family would love to come back again to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “don't stay here!!!”
Reviews.Author: bowserjrlover1000
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel because of the waterpark,the waterpark was nice but my room wasn,t. there was tape on the window and mold on the shower curtain

Reviews.Title: “Don't eat at the hotels Restaurants”
Reviews.Author: Catdog71
Reviews.Content: I believe this hotel was nice in it's prime in the early 80's but needs a lot of updating. Rooms are average but the beds are cheap and uncomfortable. Hot tub in the holidome wasn't working, neither were the pool tables, and the two hot tubs in the waterpark were lukewarm and too cold to lounge in. We ate dinner at the sports bar and was surprised at the sparse menu. We almost got up and left but stuck it out and the food was really pretty good. Ordered an appetizer due to only a few entrees including meat loaf (weird for a sports bar). Breakfast was another story. The area that breakfast is served in reminds you of an old pirates den, very strange decor. Breakfast is very overpriced and consists of the same food that most hotels include in their free buffet. Most of the servers spoke very little English. Customer service was lacking. I would probably not stay here again. Will try Great Wolfe Lodge next time.

Reviews.Title: “Love the pool”
Reviews.Author: housecoat
Reviews.Content: The pool/waterpark area is great for the family and gets the kids active after a day of sitting in the car. We love it. Overall nice place to stay with a couple good restaurants to eat at right there on premises. Will stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Inn was Right to Cut This Property Loose”
Reviews.Author: T B
Reviews.Content: Although it's hard times right now, my husband and I decided to save and do a "Staycation" at the Caribbean Cove Hotel. (formerly the Holiday Inn Select) If you're going to this hotel for ANY reason than the Waterpark, makes reservations elsewhere. To cut to the chase, the shower from the room above us leaked into our room every time anyone took a shower, someone vomited down the hallway on the way to their room and I went to the Front Desk and discreetly informed that there was a trail of vomit going down the hallway at 9:00 AM on Sunday and it didn't get cleaned up until Monday morning (DISGUSTING!), and the breakfast buffet was horrible. The eggs were hard and the potatoes were raw. Caribbean Cove Hotel's only saving grace at this point is the waterpark!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Stay EVER!!!!”
Reviews.Author: KNS2011
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel for the last three years while doing a family trip to the Zoo and Museum. The first year we stayed was not bad, but the last two years have just been awful! Our main attraction to this Hotel is the indoor waterpark for the kids, but this year that wasn't even enjoyable! The lifegaurds were NOT doing there job as kids were out of control! Many children were jumping from the edge of the lazy river onto the tubes and one child nearly smacked his head on the fake rocks around the river. I told the kids to stop, but they did not listen to me. I told the lifegaurds what was going on and they told me there was not much that they could do about it! Seriously!?!? Try kicking them out of the park if they can't follow the rules. This is what most reputable water parks do! Also, the water was very cold in all places except for the lazy river. Now let's move on to the rooms. We were given a room with two full sized beds, a small very outdated television, and no refridgerator. When going to get ice to put our drinks on, the ice machine wouldn't work. Our room didn't even have a toilet paper holder! The rooms did seem as clean as the cleaning staff could probably get them, but they still looked dirty due to how outdated everything was. When we finally decided to lay down in bed and watch a little tv, we discovered that our beds were as hard as rocks! When trying to rent a movie for our girls we discovered that our small TV's movie channels were not working. We called the front desk and they said they'd send someone up. When the they got there about 15 minutes later they informed us that the whole system was down. So great, nothing to help our children doze off to sleep in an unfamiliar place. Then when we finally decided to try to go to sleep, that's when the partying started. It literally sounded as though they were having a party right outside of our room. I tossed and turned until 1:30 AM until I finally decided that something had to be done. I contacted security who said they would be up to take care of the problem. There was only two more episodes of noise after this, but I ultimately didn't get to sleep until 2:30 AM. I informed the lady at checkout of my terrible experience, but she offered very little but a "I'm sorry to hear that." And how much did all of this cost: An extremely overpriced $235.00. Please Beware of this Hotel!!! It is NOT worth the money!

Reviews.Title: “Do not recommend”
Reviews.Author: Since01
Reviews.Content: The water park and hotel were dirty and outdated. Way OVER PRICED for what we received. Will not stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “great waterpark”
Reviews.Author: Indiana2011
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnight with my husband and 4 year old daughter . She loved the water park.Water was right temperature. Room was nice and clean.Lobby is gorgeous.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money at all!!!”
Reviews.Author: rnona
Reviews.Content: So, it is the hottest day of the year. I see this beautiful add in the Sunday newspaper and make a reservation. It was over 97 degrees outside and it felt the same inside the water park. No ventilation. The kiddie part had cool water but I didn't bring toddlers I brought my twin 12 yr old sons. We had to buy a fan for our room because it was unbearable to sleep. The manager blamed it on us turning the air to low but we actually had it set on 70. So then it was the person who stayed in our room prior to us. Wow the hallway on the 4th floor felt like you were outside. The manager said, Well, heat rises and we don't air conditon the hallway. The hallway to get into the hotel stayed unlocked. Guests were in the pool way after midnight our first night. That was blamed on security...The buffet for breakfast had a lot to be desired. If you wanted milk and coffee you had to pay for one. The waitresses barely spoke English. The best time we had was in the atrium pool area. Didn't even bother going to the water park the second day. The kids had fun there and the Childrens Museum was awesome but that is not part of the hotel just the package. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone!!!!

Reviews.Title: “If you aren't there for the water park then look elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: JasonSed
Reviews.Content: We made a quick stopover in Indy on the way to Chicago and I found this hotel for a cheap price via a hotel price offer website. The hotel is dated and really needs some general TLC to keep it on par with newer offerings. I guess the water park is the main draw, but since we were not there for that, it was a real disappointment. I was taking my wife for a romantic getaway and it was somewhat of an embarrassing start since I booked some nice hotels in Chicago. Everything was basically clean, but things felt so old that it made us wonder just how many times something can be washed and still be 'clean'. My comments might be overcritical, but there are a lot of hotels in that general area, so I would guess they need to step it up a notch if they are going to compete as a hotel and not just as a water park with rooms. Service was ok; we checked in late and someone was at the desk and gave us a key. We just slept and left, but my overall feeling was not positive. Next time we do a stopover in Indy we'll spend a little more and stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Very classy”
Reviews.Author: Lindhy
Reviews.Content: We attended a family reunion at this hotel. It has been recently renovated, and it is beautiful. From the time we walked in the front door, we were treated with respect and a spirit of helpfulness. The staff was excellent. They appeared to have a culture of service. Something added between the time we booked and the time we arrived was a free full, hot breakfast, with waiters serving. Cleanliness is number one with me, and they provided it. This hotel had apparently lost its Holiday Inn franchise sometime earlier. Believe me, they have made up for it and then some.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price.”
Reviews.Author: bkzlb
Reviews.Content: The entire hotel smelled like cigarettes. It was dirty and the elevators were slow. After our first night stay our room was finally cleaned at 5pm and the cigarette smell was worse. They sent someone up to spray the room. It did not help. Water park was under staffed.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed but the kids had fun!”
Reviews.Author: lovinlifemomof3
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and our 3 kids bought the waterpark/zoo package over spring break. I called asking for prices and information and was told that our family may not be able to get into our room until 4 but we were more than welcome to use the waterpark starting at 10Am (not true!). I was told they would try to get us into our room early and to call ahead before we got there. I asked if we could pick up our zoo tickets on the first day before check in and was told I could not (also not true). My husband then called to book the room and and asked the same questions again and he was told the same thing I was. The day we arrived in town we were told to call ahead so when we got into the Carmel area doing some shopping we called and were told that we could not use the water park early or check in to our room because it was not ready. Very frustrating. We were told we could not use the waterpark early either even though I had been told we could. The guys who answered the phone was confused as to why I was even calling so I explained what I had been told. We then were told if we wanted to we could pick up our zoo tickets but we had plans to do that the following day, So we looked up parks in the area to take our 6, 4, and 2 year old to to pass the time until they would let us use the hotel. I informed the front desk that I was given the wrong info over the phone and my husband also did the same when checking in. They barely apologized acting like it was not big deal. (I bet they would feel differently if they were trying to entertain 3 kids aged 6 and under) They did tell us that we were probably given the wrong information because their rules are different over spring break then during the rest of the year. Then their staff should be trained to give the correct information! The second big negative for our family was the water park was freezing! They keep the doors open to the waterpark area and the first section is the little kids section. All three of my kids had a blast but after 2 hours my 2 year olds teeth were chattering and my husband and I were so cold even though we were chasing after 3 children. If you are going to the waterpark take your own towels. The towels they provide are the size of a hand towel. My husband and I both agreed that when we were by the slides with one of our older two we were not cold but whoever stayed with our 2 year old was freezing. Another thing that annoyed me was that our heavy curtain in our room would not close only the sheer curtain so all night we had the city lights shinning through our room. I had a friend who used this hotel and her curtains shut so it must be a room to room deal. The room was clean but you can tell this is an older hotel. They provide Bath and Body soaps and lotions. There is not a small refrigerator in your room so bring a cooler with your kids needs and yours too. Kids eat for free but this is only because the adults meals are so expensive you wont want to eat at the hotel. There are plenty of choices right around the hotel to choose from. There is not a complimentary breakfast. So to sum this up: over spring break you can not check into your room until 4 but you are allowed to pick up your zoo or museum tickets early the day you check in. Bring your own towels to the water park and be prepared to be cold. The kids will love it and be wipped out and mom and dad too. Plan to eat elsewhere. I would not stay here unless you plan to take kids to the waterpark. I would possibly come back but only because the kids had so much fun.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all. Waterpark pricey. Nicer older hotel”
Reviews.Author: jedbassett
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay. The hotel was really busy for Spring Break week, but all in all a nice stay. The hotel has been kept up and we were impressed with the facilities. The water park is $25 a day per person, so we decided to pass and just used the pool. The "Old World Charm" was nice as the hotel was unique and nice.

Reviews.Title: “thought it was great! would def go back”
Reviews.Author: bizyblonde
Reviews.Content: When we first got there, I thought the lobby was beautiful! The staff was friendly. Check-in wasnt till 4, but had access to the pool. -which was nice. (not the waterpark, till 4) Room was nice. when traveling w/smaller children a small refrigerator wouldve been nice, cuz they do like chocalate milk on vacation. Um, we did bring our own microwave also. Sounds crazy but when trying to keep cost down it came in handy, so that we didnt have to eat out everynite, plus usually at a resteraunt u have leftovers. The water in the water park was perfect. we originally were leaving on Monday, but ended up extending our trip because it was so nice. The depth of the water in the water park was good too. we really had a good time.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay and no problems!”
Reviews.Author: xpcruiser911
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a night a few days ago for a business trip. It was an older Holiday Inn but I had no complaints. The room was clean, and hotel was perfect for an overnight stay. I'd definitely recommend it if you need a cheap stay in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy, Even on the "Quiet Side"”
Reviews.Author: Ronarchy
Reviews.Content: My room is decent and unlike others mentioned in previous reviews. However, the quiet side of the building faces a busy road, 421/Michigan Rd and is not much better than the other side that faces the highway. Got here late and unable to sleep so now a long, tiring day.

Reviews.Title: “The quality of this stay was not worth the $200 a night price.”
Reviews.Author: Scottie1968
Reviews.Content: Single female, two teen girls. The girls loved the attached water park, and it was clean and well managed. But the hotel itself left much to be desired. It was dirty and badly in need of updating. There were 28 badly patched holes in our ceiling, some sort of dark red stain on the bathroom floor, no toilet paper holder, no sink stopper, and a guest could only get ice on the first floor of this five floor hotel. The desk clerk when I checked out did not seem overly concerned. I have been in contact with the hotel management and am awaiting contract regarding a refund.

Reviews.Title: “Set your expectations accordingly...”
Reviews.Author: mlsrar
Reviews.Content: There was a slew of poor reviews preceding mine, so I want to differentiate my information from the others by separating my waterpark review, as it is, essentially, a different entity. First, if you have an expectation that you are going to be at a quiet, well-appointed four star hotel, please stop trying to deceive yourself. Unless you paid for a waterpark package, you priceline'd this property or you did not know that this was essentially a resort property. Yes, you will hear kids running. Yes, it is older. No, the rooms are not dilapidated (mostly) No, I did not feel as if I would encounter a contagious disease. Pros: Trey, and the rest of the front desk staff were OUTSTANDING. They were friendly, cognizant of Priority Club status, and willing to work with people. They exhibited qualities that were representative of the best of the best I have encountered. I got a great night's sleep. If you are a light sleeper, other properties close to 465 will wake you up due to road noise, so you should expect kids' noise. Otherwise, the beds were comfortable, equipped with an appropriate amount of pillows that varied in density. The Internet was fast, and free. In terms of noise, it is an old Holidome-design, Embassy suites' due to their predominant design, will also promote the kind of noise engendered by this design. That being said, the waterpark is relatively separate from the rest of the building and closes at 10:00. CONS: The hotel, though I got a good night's sleep was in DESPERATE need of a makeover. The hotel directory listed Pan-AM, TWA, and ATA as airlines. Come on, I can understand ATA, maybe even TWA (Their operating certificate was merged into American's in 2001), but Pan AM? Update your directory. The hotel's restaurant offered 'kids eat free' promotions. THEY OVERCHARGED US. The bill already included gratuity: 12.00 ON A 28.00 BILL. Then, they decided to add an extra $6.00. The hotel offered no apology, no compensation, nothing to smooth things over. The poor experience soured my experience at the hotel unfortunately, but it is endemic of poor-quality establishments. Trey, the host at the desk was apologetic, but the food and service manager accused me of being insubordinate and raising my voice; neither of which occured. Because of that, I cannot recommend this hotel, unfortunately. I plan on contacting the hotel's property management affiliate, www.genhotels.com with this information and will amend my report accordingly.

Reviews.Title: “clean, comfy but not worth the price...”
Reviews.Author: teamster175
Reviews.Content: I arrived at 200 am and ask for a late check out and it was not a problem, lady at check in was very nice ....got to room and it was clean bed was great, room didnt have a microwave or fridge and was a small room that appeared to be getting old and tired ( but very clean)...biggest problem was the price started at $120 I did get it for $110 + tax but considering that this is ahuge place and only had about 20 cars in the lot when I arrived, I think the price is extremely too high esp for winter time rates ,breakfast was overpriced small portions and very limited selection....no newspapers either...I could see paying this much in the middle of summer or if it was a brand new facility but for what they have to offer it should be $79 or less in the off season...descent place but priced out of reality.. many other hotels at this exit..I will try a different one next time.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME INDOOR WATER PARK”
Reviews.Author: nbafamily
Reviews.Content: Although the interior of this hotel is not five star, I thought the indoor water park more than made up for the lack of luxury. The rooms were clean and roomy enough for our family of five. The water park staff was great! Arcade and snack bar are located in the water park and they had activities besides swimming for the kids. Three different water slides make this a perfect choice for young families . Love the restuarant with the kids eat free.

Reviews.Title: “Should have read the reviews...”
Reviews.Author: IndianaJamie
Reviews.Content: We travel frequently and I often use Trip Advisor to get a real read on a property. I didn't with this one and have learned my lesson. We arrived around 7P on a Friday evening. We were in a bit of a hurry as the main attraction for this place is the waterpark and it closed at 10P. I left my family in the car while I ran in to check-in. The staff at the desk was very friendly, but couldn't find my reservation. In my haste, I didn't have the confirmation number on me. Instead of offering us available rooms, the clerk directed me to search for my confirmation on a computer in their business center. I looked, but to no avail. I searched the hotel's website and found that rooms were available. My wife had parked and come in at this point. She reminded me that we actually had called and reserved the room over the phone (remember that?). I returned to the front desk to make mention of this remembrance and also seek out the available rooms. He offered us a rate $30 higher than what we had just viewed on the website, saying that it was the best he could do. I countered with our website findings, only to be told that I was probably looking at rooms for the night before. How do you even do that? I returned to the computer to reserve the cheaper (read: same) room. It's funny that our reservation misplaced, while another reviewer had an experience where the hotel rep actually cancelled someone else's reservation. Strange. We found the room to be typical for these properties that are 30+ years old. Holiday Inns in general were classy in the 80s, but certainly need some updates. This place was no different. I didn't find the room to be completely disgusting, just old. The waterpark is much newer than the hotel, but it's hard to tell. It already looks very worn and in need of paint, caulk, etc. With a 3-year-old in tow, we naturally headed toward the shallow water of the "bucket" climbing structure and pool. We were greeted with a torn up pool bottom near a climbing crab that is so loose, it looks like seaweed as it floats atop the surface. Oh, we were also greeted by frightfully chilly water. While I'm typically a little cold while swimming, this water was downright frigid. I wanted to know that actual temperature, but could only guess it was the low 60s. I witnessed several families having the same experience. My wife asked a lifeguard; she stated that it was too cold and something was wrong with it. I asked another lifeguard, one who was a supervisor. He was flanked by two additional lifeguards who each looked at him upon my question like I had just asked about a missing person that they knew was buried in their backyard. It was obviously that it was an issue and I wasn't the first to inquire. He responded by telling me that they had to replace the water that had been splashed out and the heater hadn't caught up yet. I hardly believed that since the temperature felt 15 - 20 degrees off, not 4 or 5. I followed by asking that by the next day the temperature should be corrected. He, of course, said yes. Ironically, another reviewer from back in June had the same issue. He specifically stated that the kiddie pool was freezing. Strange. We're like most on here. We were seeking a nice getaway for our family and this seemed like a good bet. In the end, we paid nearly $200 for a rundown room and a rag-tag waterpark whose water temperature resembled actually swimming outside on a nearly-November day in Indiana.

Reviews.Title: “This Place is a Priceline DUMP Hotel”
Reviews.Author: defore4735
Reviews.Content: Just like many Priceline deals you may search for, sometimes you get coal. This hotel was definitely that! When I originally went onto Priceline to look for a hotel in the northwest area of Indianapolis, there were only 2 hotels in the area rated 3 stars. The Hilton Garden Inn and the Embassy Suites, so when I won a stay at the Holiday Inn North, I was surprised it came up, especially since there was no mention of the hotel on its listing. This hotel is a Priceline "dump" hotel. You think you may be getting a 3 star, this hotel is a 2 star at best. It is convenient off 465 with plenty of restaurants around, but that's where the good stops. Most of the reviews are correct about this hotel. How could anyone rate this as a 3 star? It's in need of a HUGE makeover. The carpets are dirty, the rooms are old, the bedding is out of date. Don't use Priceline in Indianapolis if you're searching for a quality hotel. They will stiff you with a bad hotel that isn't listed on their hotel search and you'll be stuck with a stay that's not worth the lower price you may have paid. We regretted our decision.

Reviews.Title: “Good for families with children/teens”
Reviews.Author: missourideegirl
Reviews.Content: Our soccer team stayed here while playing in a soccer tournament. The common area in the atrium with the pool had lots of room and was great for the families to gather and there were plenty of activities for the kids with game tables and an activity center. A grab-and-go breakfast was offered in our prices and they gave us a $5 discount on the water park bracelets. The rooms were acceptable for the little amount of time we were in the rooms. The rooms were dated and a mini fridge and/or microwave would have been a helpful added feature. We had trouble in a few of the rooms with A/C and clogged toilets but the maintenance man on-site was a very nice. There was a note at the front desk warning guests of recent break-ins to vehicles and not leave valuables in your vehicle, but I did see local police in the hotel throughout the weekend so it seemed as though they were trying to take care of that problem. Overall, for the purpose of our visit, the hotel was a good choice. I would not recommend this hotel for couples or business travelers.

Reviews.Title: “And This is a Holiday Inn????”
Reviews.Author: sas11560
Reviews.Content: I was traveling on business and stayed here from Sept. 20-24. The room had no microwave or refrigerator. The room was average. The carpet in the hall was visibly dirty. To regulate the room temperature either the air or the heat was running all the time....making it noisy, too hot or too cold. The worst part was no hot water to take a shower. I had complained at the desk about it and they sent someone to check it. The person that checked it said the water was hot, that I had just not turned to dial far enough. I had turned the dial as far as it would go but no hot water. Also, the water in the sink was not getting hot so it couldn't be that I didn't turn the dial far enough. I complained again the next morning and they offered to let me change rooms which I told them this was not an option for me as I was there on business and did not have the time to change rooms. I even threatened that if the hot water issue was not resolved I would not pay the bill. They said they would have someone check the water again. They also told me the me they only had one water heater for the entire motel. The next night I turned the water dial as far as it would go....still not hot water. So I let it run for about 15 minutes. Finally WARM but not hot water. I will never stay at the motel again.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place for a great price”
Reviews.Author: guiler97
Reviews.Content: We took our 6 and 8 year old sons. Upon arrival the front desk staff bent over backwards to make sure we had everything we needed including an early check in so the kids could hit the water park. Our room was on the 3rd floor with a balcony overlooking the pool. Room was very clean, had one minor problem but a call to the front desk and a service man was there to fix it within minutes. The water park kept our boys entertained for 3 days, I don't even like to swim, but I even had fun there. The only drawback that I found was the hotel sports bar was very expensive and service was terrible, but right across the street was a Texas Roadhouse and Cracker Barrel and within blocks almost any restaurant you can name. What a great stay!!! We are already making plans for a second visit.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is ok and the Waterpark is fun, but old”
Reviews.Author: Cincysse
Reviews.Content: I visited this hotel about 5 years ago and just visited yesterday. The hotel has aged. There is no mini-bar or refrigerator in the room. We went to the waterpark and there were not sufficient towels in the room for our family of three. The small, old tube TV felt ancient. The food in the restaurants in the hotel is not good. Although the "eat for free deal" for kids is good, I could have received a better tasting meal at a local restaurant. The waterpark was lots of fun, but compared to newer waterparks, there were not as many attractions for my 12 year old....nevertheless the lazy pool and tube ride was a blast. The chlorine smell resinated throughout the hotel and burnt my eyes.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: DerbyTime
Reviews.Content: I suggest you call ahead to see what activities are scheduled for your stay (birthday parites, family reunions, and other gatherings for example), weekends seem to be SOLD OUT which in our case made it difficult for us to relax and have a good time. We have small children and with the high volume of people the water park was nearly impossible. The kids could not enjoy the water park or the pool because there were so many kids. Our room was clean, I could feel the springs through the mattress, the TV was too fuzzy to watch, the water park was clean for the most part, and we did not even attempt to eat at the food court due to the people so not sure how that was. We did hear several people say that *kids eat free* because the adult is making up the difference. IF we were to ever consider staying here again I would call ahead first and try to stay during the week so it's less crowded. The Children's museum and Indianapolis Zoo were worth the trip though.

Reviews.Title: “Rip off”
Reviews.Author: Chicagolandted
Reviews.Content: Where to start??? Check in was the most unorganized experience I have ever encountered. The front desk staff was rude, almost as if they hated their jobs. The lady that checked me in, didn't care about customer service at all. While she was helping me, she kept walking away to talk with other staff members, while there was a long line at the desk. I asked for a room away from elevators, and with the waterpark included. After 25 minutes of trying to check in, I finally received my room keys. Guess what...directly next to an elevator, and they would not move us. The rooms are EXTREMELY overpriced. Beds with springs poking at you all night, wall paper tearing off walls, dirty carpet, a dropped ceiling in the bathroom with so much dirt and dust that it was actually hanging off the ceiling. In the morning, I called the front desk to get our tickets to the waterpark, they informed me that I had a no waterpark room, and there would be an additional cost of almost $100 for my family to go. After already paying $175.00 for a dirty room at a Holiday inn, nevertheless. NO WAY. After talking to a manager at the hotel, he told me that I was told that I did not get the waterpark included in my room. Others in the hotel paid $175 per night with the waterpark included...how does that work? I have always stayed away from Holiday inn type hotels, because I felt they were dumps. After the huge makeover the chain has gone through, I felt it was worth the try once again. Never again. Holiday inns have NOT changed. For the price stay downtown at the Hyatt or the Marriott. At least there, you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Only for families”
Reviews.Author: JJ53
Reviews.Content: The main attraction of this hotel is the adjoining indoor waterpark. When I was there it was filled with families who were taking advantage of the special waterpark room rates and the "kids eat free" deal. Unfortunately, the entire place smells of chlorine (from the pools) and damp carpet. Enormous families wander the halls in dripping bathing suits, carrying huge coolers of food and drink. Overworked housekeeping staff block the hallways with carts filled with wet towels. Not the best experience for a solo business traveler. On the plus side, I was placed in an area on the fifth floor that appears to be reserved for people who are not on the waterpark package -- that area was quieter, and the room was fairly large. Breakfast was included, although that required navigating through the throngs of children and stressed-out parents in the restaurant. If you're interested in an inexpensive mini-vacation with the kids, go for it. If you're in town by yourself on business -- you might do better elsewhere (it may be better midweek, in the winter...)

Reviews.Title: “beware, got someone else information just by calling to cancel.............never even made it”
Reviews.Author: bayaboo2001
Reviews.Content: whats wrong with this hotel and holiday inn! I was unable to even stay because to staff the hired doesn't understand English and booked the wrong package. so to change it i had to change my room.... then there's no room available!! I also called to cancel everything and the woman on the phone gave me another persons information and was canceling it. i cant believe how they run this hotel! I had to call over 10 time long distance to the hotel and EVER got a call back or any help. They ruined an 8yr old bday gift!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Okay Stay, Staff Friendly, but Room Not All that Clean-See Review”
Reviews.Author: ShineSense
Reviews.Content: I rated this okay as the hotel room itself was not all that clean. We requested clean sheets for the bed after seeing yellow spots. They just remade the bed, but did not change the sheets. Also, there were nasty dirt stains and holes in the curtains that were unpleasant to look at. On another note the kids had a blast at the indoor waterpark. There was an abundance of lifeguards who were excellent in providing information and securing the safety of everyone in the waterpark. Kids also eat free w/adult purchase and the staff was friendly especially our waiter Bobby at the St. Paul Cafe who provided excellent customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Did the waterpark package-nice hotel, didn't like extra charge.”
Reviews.Author: marxmans
Reviews.Content: We stayed here to go to the Caribbean Cove Waterpark and the Indy Zoo and Children's Museum. Went with immediate family also so we had 3 rooms total. The rooms were nice and clean but the beds were not comfortable for everyone. One bed was even broken so it sloped towards the floor. Rooms were not stocked with enough towels. Rooms would benefit from having refrigerators and microwaves in the rooms, especially since alot of visitors have young children and need to store milk and/or food for them. We paid and extra $10 a day to have a refrigerator, which they diidn't even plug in when they put it in the room. The pool area has several pool tables and closes promptly at 10pm, even if you are in the middle of a game (which you pay $1). Yes, that happened to us.

Reviews.Title: “Fun trip”
Reviews.Author: Alicialee45
Reviews.Content: I ignored all the nasty reviews on this website and decided to take a trip mostly for the waterpark. We had alot of fun! The hotel lobby is beautiful, the food was wonderful (although expensive) the waterpark was alot of fun, but there were some cons to this hotel. We had a room with an atrium view, with was very nice. But the room itself, just ok. I've stayed in nicer holiday inn's before. There were no empty chairs at the waterpark when we first went. We spent about 20 minutes walking around looking for a chair to put our things on. The lifeguards were all on point, but they were having a "safety drill" while we were there. We were yelled at for not being in a tube in the lazy river, which I didn't understand. NOTE: If you have small children I would avoid staying here for the waterpark. The "kiddie pool" water was FREEZING COLD. Our 7 year old wouldn't even get into it. Other than that it was a nice stay~

Reviews.Title: “Not for the business traveller...”
Reviews.Author: ricardomt
Reviews.Content: If you are on a business trip and have to get back to the hotel at night to prepare daily reports and get a deserved good night of sleep, beware. This hotel has a water park and kids run across the hallways day and night. It can get very noisy and annoying if you're trying to concentrate. On the other hand, if you're with kids and wanna have a good time by the pool in the winter, this is the place to be. Good restaurants and rooms are comfy and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Horrilble All Around”
Reviews.Author: WMHARBOR
Reviews.Content: My family and I booked a five night stay here with priceline. When we arrived the initial response was, "Oh so you booked with priceline." It should not make a difference where we booked the room, but it did and we were treated like second class citizens. The front desk attendant was very very rude and off putting. She did not even have the manners to explain to my, at that time, very ill wife where our room was exactly. I beleive that is the reason she put us in the worst room possible. The tv volume didnt work. The water in the shower never got hot. The worst part is that they really did not care. I will never stay here again. But if you like rude and nonresponsive service...this is the place for you. If not stay far far away!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay but go out for dinner”
Reviews.Author: captaincarroll
Reviews.Content: I am actually writing this using the Hotels WIFI. It is the last night of out 2 night 3 day family trip. We came specifically to this hotel because of the water part. I have two small children and they gave us a good deal on the Hotel with tickets to the Water park and Childrens museum. The Water park was great. The life guards were. extremely attentive. The rooms were nice, they were the standard i have come to expect from Holiday Inn the room was clean. There were also additional family related activities throughout the hotel which we did not anticipated. (swim lessons, organized craft times, a movie in the common area etc.) we did not take advantage of them but they will effect our decision to return. some concerns The second floor hallways smell like smoke even in the non smoking area, this did not translate to the room but i expect a hotel of this quality and reputation to be able to filter their air better especially one that prometes its self as family friendly They made a big deal about kids eating free at the dinner buffet when i booked the room. There was no dinner buffet both nights that i was here and the one resturant was closed. They do honor the kids eat free at their sports bar but that is hardley a family resturant I did eat on night their and for the waiter horrible and the menu less than family. Fortunately there are plenty of good family restrurants in the area. Over all the stay was good and i plan to come back in a few months with more family members

Reviews.Title: “Much improved in past 2 years!!”
Reviews.Author: RaeJ530
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for Grandaughters 8th birthday part y@ Caribbean cove. Must say we stayed here 2 years ago and it was nasty I even requested a refund on room since it was dirty. Happy to say they have cleaned up and new rooms atrium level are WONDERFUL!!! Beds are GREAT!!! bedding is also very nice. Room was very clean . The water park was the same however smells so high of chlorine that it stays with you for a time after you are away from park.. They now have nice regular enclosed pool which was a nice change from water park. Check in was delayed due to room not being ready but I was given a discount for this problem (with out asking for it) Check out was very smooth! We had the breakfast buffet where kids eat free w/ an adult Food was good but not great overpriced as usual with hotel restaurants. If you go ask for the atrium level of rooms as I do believe these are the new ones these rooms do not have a outside view but I never missed that they do have balcony but it leads out towards indoor pool. Really minor when you consider the rooms on this level are so nice!!! Be aware that parking is difficult the parking lot is too small for the number of people and with the water park traffic weended up parking on the street.

Reviews.Title: “Meeting rooms great, food awful”
Reviews.Author: ZebeMi
Reviews.Content: I did not stay at this hotel overnight, but did attend a conference there for three days. The building and the meeting rooms were really nice. The bathrooms were well kept, which was really nice. The lobby was inviting and the pool area looked really fun (I never went in though). The temperature of the rooms was nice for all but one of my sessions, but it had only a few people in it. HOWEVER, the food here was not very good at all. Also if you have dietary restrictions at all, BEWARE. I requested gluten free over and over, both on my registration form and when I arrived at the hotel. I reminded my server as soon as I got to the table. I did get a grilled chicken breast, but next to it I had scalloped potatoes that I'm (now) quite sure were thickened with flour. Not cool if you need to avoid gluten. I tried to ask, but the banquet manager disappeared right after I was served! The majority of the staff that I interacted with spoke either broken English or had an accent so strong it was hard to understand them. I didn't feel like they understood me either. I don't believe that the catering staff was educated at all about food allergies, much less gluten intolerance. I ended up ill as a result. While I enjoyed my time at the conference, the food was really quite disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Becareful!!!”
Reviews.Author: WesleyIndianapolis
Reviews.Content: We went to Carribean Cove with a small group today. As we were leaving, a young boy about nine or ten years of age suffered a spinal cord injury in the shallow kiddy pool area. He may have fallen off the red crab slide. The life guards quickly immobilized him and called an ambulance. A terrible and frightening thing to witness. Please think again before taking your children to this water park. This could happen again to ANY child!!! I hope this young boy will be OK.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible stay would never recommend.”
Reviews.Author: abaldwin76
Reviews.Content: We stayed here wanting to enjoy the water park. It was too overcrowded, the lifeguards were way to few for as many people who were at the park. Although there were lifeguards throughout the area, they did not enforce the rules. The front desk staff was not helpful at all. When I attempted to lodge complaints with the many levels of hotel management noone seemed to care. All my complaints have been tossed to the side. It is quite obvious that Holiday Inn is not very concerned about customer satisifaction. Both of my children were injured at the park, my fifteen year old was injured bad enough that we had to seek medical attention. Noone at the hotel seemed to think it necessary to give any attention to the matter. If you have to stay in this area I would not recommend this hotel, however I would recommend the Drury Inn across the street, better service and you get more for your money.

Reviews.Title: “The Caribbean Cove is a safety hazard for young children”
Reviews.Author: CLHFairborn_OH
Reviews.Content: First, the hotel itself is fine. Rooms are comfortable. Staff in the hotel, nice -mostly helpful. The indoor waterpark, The Caribbean Cove, is another story all together. We visited on a Friday/Saturday in winter - so it was particularly crowded. And given such a large crowd of people, there is very little staff/life guard supervision. At the entrance, it is posted that anyone visiting the waterpark is to have a wristband, however, no one checks the wristbands. Anyone can walk into the waterpark area. It also states that children under 12 are to be accompanied by parents. No one checks if a child is accompanied. It truly is a very chaotic atmosphere. Our son stayed in and by our grand children the entire time they were in the water, however, even his presence couldn't stop the rough housing by older children. (All ages of children are allowed in the same areas). Life guards do walk the pool areas, however, they appeared to ignore much of the rough housing. Our 3 year old grand child was "tackled" by two 12 (ish) year olds rough housing, and his left leg was injured. We went immediately to find first aid. The first aid we found amounted to a young lady that was able only to take an accident report and give us directions to a local hospital. A visit to the ER ended with my grandson in a cast from the top of his knee to his toes. We understand that accidents happen, but they happen more often when you have a lack of professional supervision, a lack of trained emergency staff, and particularly the uncaring attitude by some of the staff that we observed at the Caribbean Cove waterpark. It would be my opinion that if you are going to operate such a facility you would want your visitors to feel comfortable that their safety while visiting is paramount. You will not get that warm fuzzy here. We called to follow-up on the accident report that had been filed. We told the young man that our grandson had suffered a leg fracture, and that we wanted that added to the report. His response, "is that ALL you wanted?", and he hung up. Rude, uncaring, unprofessional! A symptom I think of how the waterpark appears to be run. Obviously, we will never visit again, nor would we ever refer anyone we cared about to this facilty.

Reviews.Title: “One word review: Disgusting Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelBoulder
Reviews.Content: This hotel is disgusting. I stayed in room 401 on the Club Level. Toilet clogged called front desk at 6 pm before going out to dinner and they said they would send someone. They never did so I returned at 10 still clogged then told no one from maintenance on duty. In addition, the heating system didn't function properly. Two options inferno or igloo. By the way my room had one of the funkiest smells like old cooking grease. Just to make night complete, saw a cockroach running across my toiletries in bathroom. I swear this cold make the list of Dirtiest Hotels in America. Really gross. Better options around, if you really must stay in this part of Indianapolis.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service Horrible”
Reviews.Author: hutson1
Reviews.Content: We took our daughter (2yrs old) to this Hotel, for the purpose of ther water park. I reserved our stay through the generic Holiday Inn Reservation number. I asked the representative if the price included the tickets for the water park. Her response was that it was all included. We were very excited at this point. Uon arrival we were informed that we had to pay an additional $20.00 per ticket to enter the water park. We figured since we drove 2 hours, we might as well obsorbe the cost and continue. Later that night the Hotel was attacked by hundreds of cheer leader who had no respect for the other guests. We were awaken multiple times through the night by cheerleaders running up and down the halls. This was a holy terror for parents of a two year old. The Front desk responded by stating, girls will be girls. For breakfast we ordered room service. We were informed of a $2.00 delivery fee and 20% gratuity.....once again for the sake of a good time we obsorbed the cost. 1 1/2 hours later out food arrived, yet was not what we ordered.....I contacted the room service advisor who stated they would make the order right and bring it to me as soon as possible. I contacted them 45 min later and they forgot about my order. 15 min later a delivery guy whom couldnt speak english brough me a mixture of things from the buffet. Once again i called the room service advisor who stated they were busy and wouldnt be able to make the correct order, so thought it was acceptable to give me a variety of things from the buffet. .....custonmer serive blows.....not worth money

Reviews.Title: “Great place for families to bond - kids loved the park and great prices too”
Reviews.Author: 1drwmn1964
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Carribean Cove in Indianapolis. My 7 & 9 year boys loved the waterpark, the arcade, ping pong, games and everything the hotel had to offer. It was great value - we got a two night special. With that we also received "kids eat free" coupons so it really helped with the $$. We looked at going to Great Wolf Lodge, but it was so much more $$ - plus we'd been there before. I can also say the staff at the Cove were super friendly and very service focused. The life guards take their jobs seriously and I appreciated their focus on water safety and helping the kids. It was a nice and clean waterpark. All in all, it was super value for the money. The hotel room we had was a little small and we're not used to double beds, but hey, we weren't there for the room anyway - the overall hotel was great and we plan to go back again!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: pete_mmpr
Reviews.Content: The hotel is dark and really not in good shape, but that I could live with. A real problem was that heating did not work at all in the room, and at night it get kind of cold in Indianapolis in November. On top of this, they do not provide hot water at night! I had to get up at 3am to catch an early flight out of Indianapolis and there was no hot water! Unbelievable.

Reviews.Title: “Front Desk Staff are LIARS!!!”
Reviews.Author: msyeow
Reviews.Content: Unless you get a SUPER good deal on this hotel and waterpark stay away!!! Even if you do find a GREAT deal on price, the front desk staff will LIE to you about when your room is ready, if they can get you a room on the atrium, and how they can't find two adjoining rooms. Here's my story: We reserved two adjoining rooms (they said they can't guarantee they had two ADJOINING) - we go to check in and the lady says, " I don't have two adjoining rooms, on the atrium" - ok so I take one, THEN the lady behind me asks for two adjoining rooms and the same lady says, "I have them right here" - WHAT??? I just asked for the same thing!!! She says, "Oh, the manager did not flag your reservation, blah,blah" She is a LIAR! Because I asked to speak to the manager and he gave me two adjoining rooms on the atrium. The entire front desk staff should be fired. The hotel itself is badly in need of updating, the restaurant was passable. The water park is okay - needs new towels - the ones they have are thread bare.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: KyPair
Reviews.Content: We visited over 4th of July holiday. Room was great. Loved staying with view of HoliDome. Water in hotel pool ridiculously frigid. Fun the water park.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, disappointed in the overnight front desk staff”
Reviews.Author: gz4874
Reviews.Content: Our travelling party consisted of myself, my husband, and our two small children. We arrived early on a Friday afternoon and were allowed to check-in early, which was nice. It was a very busy weekend due to some weddings and a family reunion so the lobby was packed. The concierge found us a luggage cart despite the crowd which allowed us to get up to our room in one trip. The room was clean and the hotel was well maintained, but my complaints lie in two areas. One - The Holidome pool was freezing. Entirely too cold to put a small child in it. Even the older teenagers were complaining that it was too cold. Two - The overnight staff. At approximately midnight, one of my children became sick in the room. All of it was contained on the bedding so I stripped the bed down and called the front desk to ask for replacement linens. I was told that it would be a minimum of two hours. I asked for directions to the laundry room to get new linens myself and was told that guests are not allowed in the laundry area. Since that wasn't good enough for me, I rolled all of the soiled linens up and threw them in the hallway next to our door. I then wandered around the hotel until I found the laundry area. There was a woman in there that didn't speak any English, but was more than willing to give me whatever I wanted. She basically pointed to the shelves of sheets and linens and let me take what I wanted. She also got me some new blankets and pillows. I called the front desk when I returned and explained that the soiled linens were in the hallway and did not smell very good so they should try to address that immediately. The next morning when we checked out (9 AM), the linens were still sitting outside our door. We won't stay at this hotel again due to our treatment overnight by the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Smokey halls/rooms and Caribbean Cove was dirty....”
Reviews.Author: mbenham2
Reviews.Content: We we're heading South to Kentucky and surprised our kids with a stop off at this hotel....only because of the indoor water park. We first were given non-smoking room 210, but it was so horribly smokey (along with the hallways), we asked to move. Room 214 was slightly better, but you could still smell the smoke. $149 a night for the room and 4-9 pm water park. The water park was not that great. Doesn't compare to the cleanliness and expansiveness of Great Wolf Lodge. I'd save your money for that park. The area near the pirate ship and bucket drop smelled. Not sure from what. The pool walls were all grimey and dirty. Obviously cleanliness was not a priority. Lots of workers were on hand though, they outnumbered the number of guests at the waterpark. I would not return to this hotel/waterpark again, nor would I recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, everything else was average”
Reviews.Author: stumperman1
Reviews.Content: I thought this was an okay stay. We stayed for two nights, and for the most part enjoyed it. The beds were comfortable, the rooms were clean. The showers were nice, as was the rest of the bathroom. The hallways and rest of hotel could use an deep cleaning or some renovation. The buffet was good but a bit pricey and the food was not the greatest nor was the breakfast selection. The inner pool closes around 10 or 11pm but remained noisy beyond that with kids yelling around the game areas. We were also awakened both mornings with loud music coming from the pool area again, and many staff members were joining in the dancing and encouraging the loud music, perhaps it was a scheduled event. The water park area was the best part. The kids enjoyed it, the staff was helpful and did their best with what seemed to be limited resources. I think with some good management and maybe some upgrades this could be a better hotel, but it is not too bad as it is now.

Reviews.Title: “Water park down all day long!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: mejlow
Reviews.Content: This was a horrible stay and we will NEVER be back. We picked this hotel for the WATER PARK the first day we checked in at 4p and went to the waterpark to order a pizza and bread sticks before we went swimming. We where told there would be a 10 min. wait which was fine about 20 minutes later I had to go and ask about it and then got the pizza and I asked where my breadsticks where and they told me that would be another 10mins so I tried to cancel the breadstick they could not do that to much of a hassle. The water park was great for the 3 hours we got to use it only thing is they didn't have enough tubes and you had to wait forever to get one. The next morning we went down to go to the water park and a sign was up it was CLOSED and to see the front desk, I was told they had a problem overnight and it should be open in an hour which would have been 11am, It wasn't so went back and was told it would not be open til 3p I ask for a refund and told them we would leave and they said they could NOT do that. We could swim in the hotel pool which was ICE cold and not suitable for young children which we had. 3pm came and went still no water park. So about 6pm I went back to front desk again and told them we wanted to leave if they could not give us a time the park was going to open. The lady told me she had no idea if the waterpark was going to open that day or even the next and told me she didn't see any reason why they would not refund me earlier in the morning and I did get my money back for one night but we didn't stay at the hotel that night anyways. But the point is they gave me the run around and i wasted a whole day of our vacation waiting on this waterpark to open that never did!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: carolstig
Reviews.Content: The 8-year-old enjoyed the waterpark, but would have been just as happy with the free pool. The waterpark ran out of towels. The food was ho-hum with five-star prices. Avoid the yummy wounding cinnamon french toast. It is terrible. The only reason to go there is there is nothing else in Inde of interest to an 8-yr-old and adults who don't want to run the museum marathon.

Reviews.Title: “Significantly overpriced”
Reviews.Author: gewf631
Reviews.Content: The hotel is older, but has been updated. Bathroom (especially the tub) is small. Only sleeping option is 2 double-beds, or 1 king-sized bed. Best rate, without the waterpark, is around $150/night. We stayed with a family/museum/water park package (around $300 for the night). The breakfast buffet wasn't anything special (dry pancakes, scrambled-eggs, and fruit and yogurt). The waterpark wasn't anything special (especially if you have to spend the extra $20 per person), and even the museum tickets weren't really a value. My advise - seek-out any of the lesser-priced chains (with their breakfast buffet) - you'll pay about half, and even if you bought museum tickets, they're only about $50 for a family of 4.

Reviews.Title: “We had our best hotel stay ever.”
Reviews.Author: jusmegste93
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Indianapolis on a family vacation. We have an 8 yr. old and a 16 yr. old. We stayed with the Caribbean Cove package deal. We received 2 nights stay, unlimited access to their indoor water park, 4 tickets to the Indianapolis Zoo and 4 tickets to the Children's Museum of Indianaplois for a very economical price. We loved the water park and could have spent our entire stay there. Our room was very clean, spacious and quiet. Our only complaint was a television that was on its last leg. Evidently, we got a room that had not yet been updated with a newer one. We did not tell the hotel staff that we were displeased with it until we checked out. They would, probably, had done something about it had we mentioned it to them. Our every need was met with a smile. The ENTIRE staff was cordial. Every staff member we encountered said "hello" and smiled. I don't think it would be possible to ever match the friendlinest of this hotel staff. That says something about the management when the employees appear this happy in their jobs. We plan on returning for a future visit and will definitely plan our stay at this hotel. We highly recommend it to everyone who enjoys a fun and economical place to visit with children of all ages.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome staff and great value for lots of fun”
Reviews.Author: IllinoisFamilyoffive
Reviews.Content: We called for the Splash and Discover package and it was much cheaper than online rates. 2nd night was free and we got 4 passes to the Indianapolis Children's Museum. Package included 4 water park bracelets for 3 days. The customer service at the hotel was top notch. The guys at the Calypso Cafe were awesome and very nice. The guy at the ticket counter for the game room was very nice as well. My kids were a few tickets short for a prize they really wanted and they gave it to hem anyway. Waterpark was great!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place”
Reviews.Author: chillIndiana
Reviews.Content: We just got back to day from a weekend trip to Indy for spring break. There were 10 of us all together. It was but 1 night get 1 free GREAT VALUE!! My children ages 16, 11, & 7 and niece 9 and nephews 12 LOVED the waterpark. I enjoyed the hot tubs in the park. It was sold out all weekend but the water park was never overloaded as I had read in other reviews. Kids eat free w/ adults in the cafe in the lobby. Very affordable and wonderful buffett. Rooms were clean...good sized and very pleasent. Our room was on the ground floor close to the waterpark but very quiet. My brothers room was across the hall and had access to the holidome. This was great...Great pool area...WONDERFUL Kids club my daughters and niece loved it. The staff was top notch. I had heard stories of high chlorine in the pool but we thought it was ok...no smell of it...and we didnt smell like it when we came out of the water. The exercise area was nice. Beautifuly decorated lobby, holidome and cafe. Overall we all LOVED IT!!! I will definetly bring my family back again.

Reviews.Title: “It was not one of the best experiences”
Reviews.Author: Roxegirl
Reviews.Content: I always like to give a hotel a second chance but I am beginning to think I could be wrong. We arrived at the hotel at approximately 9:00 pm. The parking lot was packed to the gils. Not many places to park at all. Direction were given to our room and we went and found a parking spot which of course was nowhere where we needed to be. After finding our room we went in to relax as it was almost bedtime. We attempted to turn on the TV using the remote control and it did not work. We even attempted to put in new batteries as my husband had some with him but it still did not work. This hotel has an indoor water park and the hotel attempts to advise folks that there is a "quiet time" between 11:00 pm and 7:00 am. Well forget that - there were kids running up and down the hall at all hours. If you are looking for a good nights sleep forget about this place. The beds are as hard as rocks. Like sleeping on a cement slab and the windows are not insulated well and you can hear the traffic all night. I realize that this is an older hotel but they do need to make alot of upgrades. The only bright spot in our stay was the breakfast buffet. It was very good but the table that we sat at was so coated with syrup that every time you put your hand down on top or on the sides it stuck there. I very highly doubt that we will ever go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED THIS PLACE!!!”
Reviews.Author: N717JG
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on business. I had stayed here previously, about 2 years ago when it was a Holiday Inn Select, so there are a few comparisons I can make. First of all, While I like Noble Roman's Pizza, I miss the Pizza Hut Express that was in there when it was a HI SELECT. Second, why did they have to remove the Piano? But the rooms were just as clean and wonderful as I remembered. The beds were comfortable, and when I asked for a balcony room, they gave me one with no trouble (which was awesome considering I was only paying $41.00) I wish that this was still a Holiday Inn Select, as it catered more to the type of clientele I am used to being around. (business travelers). The INDY SPORTS GRILLE was better off as BENCHWARMERS, but the staff were nice, and I enjoyed Caribbean Cove. Wonderful Wonderful Place, and I will return here if I am in the IND area again.

Reviews.Title: “Great family experienc”
Reviews.Author: mattntara
Reviews.Content: We just spent the Friday after Thanksgiving at this hotel. We are a family of 2 adults and 2 children ( 6 and 8 years old)so we had reserved a king room with a pull out couch. Upon check-in we were given a room with 2 double beds.. caught the wording and showed them our original booking. No problem we were given 2 adjoining queen rooms- perfect. We arrived early so we had all day at the water park and the rooms were ready. The kids needed a snack after a few hours of swimming so we went to the snack bar and bought 3 sodas and a pretzel with cheese for $10.00. That night we went out to dinner- plenty of restaurants nearby. Sat. morning we got up and had breakfast at the hotel, kids eat free. I think the adult buffets were $10.00 not too bad. We were allowed late check out- 12:30. We headed home in the afternoon but could have stayed until 10pm. We found the front desk extremely helpful as well as friendly. The life guards are no nonsense which was very reassuring. Yes at times you had to wait for a double tube but once we got one we just held onto it. We will be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Rip Off”
Reviews.Author: Indianapolis_8
Reviews.Content: Unbelievable horrible experience at this hotel for my daughter’s 10th bday…when I called reservations I secured a ground room floor for easy access to and from the pool. The day I checked in after waiting 30 minutes in a sea of parents and children at 4PM (yep can’t check in until 4P and check out is 11AM next day) I was given my plastic key. It didn’t work. I inquired with a maid and she happily let me into the room I wasn’t supposed to be in on the ground floor which I booked. Instead, I found out I was four floors up from that location. Irritated, I didn’t complain about the change of rooms; however, I did purchase 3 additional swimming wrist bands @ $20 each. Not 20 minutes after checking in, I found out that the 3 additional guests weren’t coming, thus inquired about a reimbursement for the unused swim wrist bands. I was told there is a strict no refund and perhaps I should try to SELL them in the lobby of people who are waiting to check in to their rooms. (Scalping wrist bands I inquired?) I asked to speak to the manager, but to no avail. I was put on hold and returned to the same clerk with the same answer. My children; however, did have fun swimming, but pictures from the web made Caribbean Cove look huge, but is much smaller than it looks. The locker room REEKED of urine. The rooms are small. For an overnight stay with 5 swim wrist bands I paid $364. I NEVER write reviews, but felt compelled to let others know about this. Yes, I did speak to the front desk the next day. I was reimbursed for the wrist bands. My recommendation for a run-down, hyped-up swim excursion is don’t waste your time or money.

Reviews.Title: “Cold Water!”
Reviews.Author: Hoosier_Family06
Reviews.Content: Our son (age 4) and daugher (age 7) love Great Wolf Lodge. We've been to the one in Mason, Ohio twice. Last winter my wife and I thought we'd try Caribbean Cove right here in Indiana. We were very, very disappointed. The rooms are adequate, and the breakfast is alright, but the reason we chose Holiday Inn - North at the Pyramids was for the water park. What a mistake. It's much, much smaller than Great Wolf Lodge, and that's OK, but the water was so COLD it was simply unbearable. After no more than 10 minuntes we left.
