Fortunately, we're familiar with Indianapolis so we could find other enjoyable things to do. (Indianapolis is a great city). Caribbean Cove however is a complete waste of time and space! Stay someplace without a "water park," and save the money!

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service is Awful!!”
Reviews.Author: eiurichter
Reviews.Content: DO NOT STAY HERE!!! Let's just say I didn't even make it there. I reserved the room a month prior to my one night stay. When I called to reserve, I asked many questions to make sure I had my facts straight about the room and waterpark. I asked if I was able to use the waterpark if I arrived early before my check-in time of 4pm. I was informed by one of their staff that this would be perfectly ok. I called the night before to confirm my reservation and asked again if it would be ok to use the park if I arrived early and the lady at the desk told me no. She informed me that I was not able to use the park until 4pm at the time of my check-in. Now this upset me because the only reason I had booked the hotel was because of the waterpark's all day use. I was also traveling from 3 HOURS AWAY to celebrate my anniversary at this waterpark. Since it was my anniversary I had planned to go to dinner. So between check-in, waterpark, showers, and dinner, I was paying $230 to use the park for a grand total of 3 hours. I called the Guest Relations number (A.K.A Corporate) and they informed me that there was nothing that they could do and that it was up to the hotel itself. Very upset by this, I called the hotel back and I talked to several people in charge and all of them were very rude and not accomidating. Not one person would do anything to help me! I couldn't belive it! I even asked if they could just send a credit to another branch closer to my home and they refused. After talking to a very nice lady at a branch close to my home, she recommeneded to call my credit card company and dispute the charge. I did this and the results are pending. I will never stay at another Holiday Inn. Please do not go through all of this trouble for a romantic night away...stay at home!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lower your Expectations to VERY LOW!”
Reviews.Author: Inspector-19
Reviews.Content: Bring your cow bell because the management will treat you like cattle! Don't waste the breath or emotion to complain if you reserved an upgraded pool side nonsmoking room on the first floor and they gave you a smoking room that overlooks the dumpster. The management simply doesn't care. The manager actually told me that I should contact Holiday Inn - Corporate about this problem, because he is just a franchisee, and why should the franchisee suffer as a result of what was in his opinion a "reservation error". I can assure you that there was not error in the reservation on our end. . . . My wife takes copious notes! You will be much happier if you consider your stay more along the lines of a camping trip! So, bring a big cooler of your own food and beverages of choice, avoid the restaurants if you can (try the mall at Keystone Crossing with Cheesecake Factory, PF Chang's etc.), and be prepared for cold showers and no water pressure . . . all for about $300/night! As for the water park, it delivers as expected. It's a notch down from the Kalahari or Greywolf lodges, but it's slightly cheaper as well. So go for the kids and enjoy! Just don't expect much in the way of service or a smile. Think of this review while you are waiting in line to check in. I promise that you will be overcome with an uncontrolable urge to "Moo". Leave you expectations in your dresser at home, so you can save them for the inveitable trip to Disneyworld - that's where your memories will be made anyway!

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad!”
Reviews.Author: travelfreek1
Reviews.Content: We went to this hotel with a group recently and were satisified. Check-in was quick and easy, got up to our room on the 3rd floor. Clean and nice, but nothing new or fancy. We also had ajoining rooms with some others from our group. The waterpark is a lot of fun! There is a lot to do, expically w/younger kids. The arcade and snack bar upstairs from the waterpark (but with stair access from it), also where the parents sat. The arcade is pretty small. but fun! When we went, the hotel was (i'm guessing) sold out, becuase the lines for everything were bad!! To get a personal pan pizza from the snack bar at the waterpark, we must have waited 30 minutes, there were so many kids, not enough staff or cooking space to acc. everyone. The food was ok. Other than the snack bar, the only other place we ate was the snack bar in the other part of the hotel-he holidome area. This is the pool area for hotel guests w/o the waterpark pkg. We ate breakfast here and the biscuits and gravy were not very good. I think the gravy had been sitting there too long. We did not have the buffet as there were around 20 people in our group at $10/person! All-in-all, we had a pretty good experience with our stay at this holiday inn. I will say that I have seen much better from holiday inn's, but what can you expect when you have hundreds of kids every night running around the place. If you are planning on staying for business, I would suggest another hotel. This hotel is SO kid friendly, which is what we liked most! We will be back! Oh, and another thing-plan on taking the stairs a lot, as the elevators are all over the hotel, but the one in our area there was constantly a line, and at one point in our stay, that particular elevator was broke and marked "out of order"

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Winter Getaway”
Reviews.Author: 4KIDSMOM69
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our annual President's Day Weekend trip to Holiday Inn North and Caribbean Cove Water Park. This trip is always the highlight of a long and cold Midwest Winter. Upon arrival, I checked in and was informed that some of the rules had changed. Although we checked in at 2pm (same as previous years) we had to wait until 4pm to access the water park. Only one of our two rooms booked was ready, so we all cramed into one room until the other one was done around 3:30pm. (Check in time is 4pm, so this wasn't that big of a deal.) The hotel is now selling water park passes to the public without renting a room, although the web site still says that the only way to access the water park is with reserving a room. The rooms were clean and tidy. We had to call maintence to replace the light above the bathroom sink, and to try and fix the sliding patio door (the door was really hard to open) and the toilet got clogged. The hotel was clean and the staff was friendly. There is always someone from housekeeping coming around the atrium area and water park picking up dirty towels and bringing out clean towels. The water park has a policy that all children that are not potty trained must wear swim diapers. I saw one child who I don't think was potty trained, without a swim diaper, only in training pants. A short time later, they had to close down the zero depth pool, because someone had lost some fecal matter in the water. Was it that baby with only the training pants on? That is what the swim diapers are for!! The kids were having fun in the water park, so we decided to eat dinner in the Cafe St. Paul restaurant in the hotel. We ate the dinner buffet. It was not very good. However the breakfast buffet the next morning was very good, and the food from the sports bar was very good. If you go to this hotel and are expecting peace and quiet, you will be disappointed. This hotel is noisy and full of kids. Overall, we had a very good experience again this year and will go back next February.

Reviews.Title: “Just average - I probably won't be back.”
Reviews.Author: BlastChamber
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night in October, 2007 while on business. There was some sort of Pepsi convention/business meetings going on during check-in, so the parking lot and lobby were packed. Still, check-in went smoothly. Got a standard room on the first floor. This hallway apparently leads to the water park/pool area, so there was lots of noise to be heard in the room. Some drunk joker was even yelling out in the hallway at 3am and woke me up. My room didn't have a TV remote, which was no big deal for one night. I called the desk to note it so I wouldn't get charged for it. Otherwise the room was OK, albeit small. However, I think there are better choices in the Indianapolis area for Holiday Inn travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Family Getaway”
Reviews.Author: regularguy79
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay close and try the waterpark for our fall break. We really loved it! Slides (3) were fast and the kids loved it that they went outside. Splash pool, play pool and lazy river were well done. We'd recommend it for toddlers to tweens. The lifeguards were very attentive and constantly patrolled all areas. There must have been at least 6 on duty at all times. They take 10 minute breaks on the odd hours. I didn't see many teens and suspect they'd get bored before long. The hotel is showing its age, but the rooms are decent for the money. We comfortably slept five in our king w/ sleeper and port-a-crib. (8, 5, and 17 mos.) As with all hotels in this class, the bathroom is never large enough. But it was clean and the linens were above average. The staff were friendly. The restaurants are mixed. The sports grill is surprisingly good with a nice menu of standards and upscale salads. (You're on vacation; get the onion rings!) The breakfast buffet is not worth the money- even considering the kids eat free. Didn't try the breakfst menu. Our only complaint is the on-line booking through the chain website. We learned that a better deal can be obtained by calling the hotel directly. Also, while we did not have this problem, other guests were unaware that the waterpark is available only if you book that package.

Reviews.Title: “It was decent”
Reviews.Author: INresident
Reviews.Content: I was a little concerned by the other posts but overall the hotel was clean, the conference rooms were very adequate. I loved the coffees and teas provided for the attendees. The restaurants on site were helpful for those of us who did not want to leave. The rooms weren't fancy and very new but everything was clean. For one night and for business meetings it really is ideal. For an extended vacation the only bonus would be the water park.

Reviews.Title: “It's okay”
Reviews.Author: webbles
Reviews.Content: Okay so I am not overly impressed with this hotel. It's just okay. When we arrived it was very busy but the front desk staff was quick and friendly. I went with my mother who is disabled and I had asked for a handicapped room that was smoking. We did get it and it was huge! But... there was no remote for the tv, there was no ash tray. There was an old glass of water in the mini-fridge. I called the front desk and they had the items brought up with a half hour or so. The hotel says they have in room games, yeah they do for $6.95 an hour. For the amount that we paid for the room you would think they could come down on the price a little. There was no in room menu for room service, no listings about area attractions. Okay so the water park, LOUD! My daughter is six and she had a ball but I was kind of bored. I agree with the other that said the lifeguards are not real friendly but they seem to know their jobs. Over all I would probably not stay here again but go to the Lodge place down by Kings Island.

Reviews.Title: “Not so good”
Reviews.Author: danzlake
Reviews.Content: I would have to say that pretty much what you have read would be true. The waterpark was fun. My six year old had a great deal of fun, and although the lifeguards were less than friendly they were professional and I never felt I couldn't take my eyes off my son. All in all, not bad. Not Kings Island though. As for the hotel itself? Absolutely awful. Service was horrible. Our bathroom needed to be recleaned (which I called about and they never did), the furniture was missing pieces, there were fruit flies in the bathroom (never did figure that out) and when we requested extra pillows they never came. I would have to say that you would be better off staying at a lower priced, but cleaner hotel and going to an outdoor waterpark also in Indy. Or just go to Kings Island.

Reviews.Title: “Great fun for the kids....no doubt!!”
Reviews.Author: GreenwoodClaus
Reviews.Content: We went to the hotel, to experience the Carribean Cove attraction ....my 6 year old loved seeing all the slides and pools when we showed him the brochures. He was very eager and got the $180 to go via gift certificate (pre-requested b day gift).. this is a great way to have a child this age make the big splash... yes the costs are over priced but as a true "fun for kids" idea the hotel scores very high!! The check in was short ( 5 mins on a Thurs) and check out a bit longer (12 mins on Fri am) but the rooms were clean & the noise not bad at all. The water park is tremendous fun for any kid.....my 3 year old was soaked from head to toe as well and loved being in the kiddie korner. My 6 year never had more fun... beats the zoo (after the 1st time there), the museums, the movies....etc. Only the state fair might equal the fun quotient Carribean Cove offered to all of us. The slides are absolutely over the top drenching excitement-- no let down!! Yes, 1 adult should be more water-eager and we did not buy any overpriced food sold there. We drove out, and ate for cheaper. The arcade was very impressive though another cost to bear and the lifeguard staff was hands down great!! The proximity of the rooms is ultra convenient & the quiter hot pools are a welcome break from all the rah-rah action of running up to the slides. I loved just floating around the wave-pool river....that was really enjoyable!! The fewer small children a parent decides to bring the better, I think--- but it's a no-miss "love ya, kid" reward or gift .The accomodations are very comfy.. yes its clean and friendly. Our family bought modest souvenirs & drove 30 mins to get there each way. We plan to go back--- family of 4-- in March after IRS season--- or unless it becomes a Christmas wish somehow!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Bad ...”
Reviews.Author: Dewitttraveler7
Reviews.Content: The water park is a mini-version of Great Wolf Lodge. It's fun for small children (10 or younger) but it's not an all day affair. The room rates seem high for the size of the park. The actual water park is clean and there are plenty of lifeguards. The rooms were just okay, not very clean. Service is horrendous. Everyone is apathetic, no one is helpful and none of the employees are knowledgeable about the rest of the hotel. They are in desperate need of a competent food service manager. Don’t even attempt eating at any of the restaurants. Room service was just as bad. The hotel has potential, it just needs better management.

Reviews.Title: “Never stay here”
Reviews.Author: ourlynx
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel my family and I have ever not stayed. I booked it for 199.00 for four during our spring break. My two boys, ages 7 and 4 were so excited to go to a hotel with such a cool sounding water park attached. To make a very long story short. We arrived at 4:00 checked in after waiting in a rather long line. When our room finally became ready we were greated at the door with several hotel employees coming out of our room with heavy cleaning equipment, like something really bad had happened in our room. When we asked what was wrong they just looked at us, gave strange looks to one another and left. It was like we suprised them or something. I can't say enough about our dirty room. It was so gross that I never let my feet touch the floor without shoes on. The water park was also very dirty. To top it off, we were in the water for maybe 20 min and the staff decided to do a 45 min rescue drill in the middle of our time. They were rude about getting everyone out of the water and we stood there cold. We could only tolerate six rides down the slide before the grossness of the place got to us. We went back to the room, changed clothes and went to dinner hoping things would improve. Horrible food-don't waste your time or money. We went back to the room, took one more look around and decided we just could not sleep there. We checked out at 8:00 and drove three hours home to take a shower before bed. My husband called the management, but has yet to receive a phone call back. That was three days ago. Please do not stay at this place, it was a very bad experience for us and I can't imagine how anyone could say this was a clean place.

Reviews.Title: “Not Good”
Reviews.Author: lamberh
Reviews.Content: We had planned to stay two nights, but after arriving, I cancelled the second night. It was so crowded it was ridiculous. Our room was so tiny and the toilet didn't work. It says the water park is only available to guests, yet the hotel is rented out to private parties, so we had a barrage of people in the pool and holidome area, I felt uncomfortable letting my children in the pool. It was complete chaos! The loud music, it didn't stop until after 11pm. The waterpark was ok, same though, very crowded and lots of rowdy kids with no supervision. It is not as great as the website makes it look. It is such a huge hotel, and they try to cram as many people in as possible, and the pool could not be any smaller for a hotel of this size. We will not return.

Reviews.Title: “Had a Great Time”
Reviews.Author: Muncietraveler
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel around 11:45 (me and three 13 year old boys) and were greeted by an extremely friendly, courteous, and enthusiastic “Debbie.” She informed us that our room was all ready and we immediately were able to get into our room. Our room was clean, properly stocked, and I was impressed with the cleanliness of the entire hotel, in addition to all the staff that I observed continually cleaning up. As they provide the towels, I was also impressed that the tables were always stocked with clean, fresh towels by the poolside and in the waterpark. I thought the lifeguards were okay – they have a monotonous job doing what they do in such an enclosed, loud environment. I thought the people behind the eateries within the hotel and waterpark were very friendly – even the clerks who work the arcade and the prize counter were very friendly with what they have to deal with day-in and day-out. Overall, I felt we really got our monies worth by arriving early one day and then staying the next day until 3 PM. My only recommendation would be an outdoor deck of some sort for parents to be able to sun outdoors when the weather is nice. When the boys got tired of the waterpark, they would walk around the hotel, spent time in the arcarde and played pool.

Reviews.Title: “Rundown rooms, rude lifeguards”
Reviews.Author: tjmiller03
Reviews.Content: The rooms were rundown. In the bathroom the tile was cracked and missing in some places. The ceiling tile was moldy. There was dried finger nail polish still on the bathroom counter. The wallpaper was peeling in the room. The windows actually had ice forming on the INSIDE of the glass. We could feel cold air coming through while laying in the bed. The waterpark itself was nice. The different pools are great for kids. The lifeguards were rude and not very friendly. They were mostly high school and college kids. I think they should charge less for the rooms if they are going to keep them in poor condition.

Reviews.Title: “Great time!!!”
Reviews.Author: hollijs01
Reviews.Content: The waterpark is great for kids 12 and under. It was a nice time for the parents too. We got lucky and went overnight on a Sunday so it was really empty on Monday. The hotel room was nice. The restaurant, not so nice. It's worth leaving the hotel to eat. The arcade is nice and the snack bar wasn't overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “No Hot Water to Shower after swimming”
Reviews.Author: truthfulIndianapolis
Reviews.Content: We swam most of the afternoon at Carribean Cove. We went to our room to shower,relax and have dinner. There was NO HOT water. We were moved to three rooms with the promise of hot water. The water was FREEZING in all three rooms. Our family drove home that evening smelling of CHLORINE, hungry, tired and very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Our family LOVED this place”
Reviews.Author: Barnes5
Reviews.Content: Our family decided to give this place a try, even after we read some of the negative reviews. I have to say we had a wonderful time. Quick check in, no lines for the water-slides, and a friendly staff. The only thing that they could do to change the experience, would be to lower the prices on the food. Kids eat free with a paying adult. We paid almost $30 for 4 personal pan pizza, 2 orders of breadsticks, and 4 drinks. I do not see where any of that was free. Our kids are begging to go again in 2007.

Reviews.Title: “Worth it”
Reviews.Author: Advisor/Traveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed there on 11/10/06 with four 10 year old girls having a birthday party. We had a king size bed and a sofa bed. The room also had a desk, chair, coffee table, dresser and spacious bathroom. There was room for all 5 of us. I reserved the room because of the Caribbean Cove Waterpark. However, I was pleasantly surprised with everything else the hotel offered. The hotel was sold out that night. Even so, the waterpark and holidome pool never felt too busy or overcrowded. I didn't experience any problems checking in or out. The girls enjoyed playing billiards (pool), ping pong, miniature golf (small course, but still entertained them), and foosball as well as swimming in the holidome area. A game of pool and foosball costs 50 cents each, not a big deal to me. The other games were complimentary. We were given KIDS EAT FREE coupons upon check in, so we all had pizza or breadsticks and a drink for $8.00 TOTAL on Friday night for a snack. Not too bad as far as I'm concerned. The Kids Club also offered a movie night that I observed younger kids enjoying outside of the pool area in the holidome. In the morning, the Kids Club offered free milk and donuts, and the hostess also provided us with a picture of the girls as a souvenir. The waterpark was fun for all of us. The slides were fun, the "lazy river" was enjoyable, and we had a blast shooting hoops in the pool w/basketball goals on tall wooden stilts. There is also a Chuck E. Cheese-like arcade on the 3rd floor of the waterpark. The girls were able to redeem their tickets for prizes there. All of the games I observed were 1-2 tokens like at all the other arcades I've been. For the entire experience, I spent approximately approximately $260.00 (I could have spent less, but I had fun giving the girls money in the arcade), and I was pleased with what a great time we had. The room was clean, the front desk was quick and efficient--even w/a packed house, no long lines for us. The staff was friendly and helpful. One thing to note, (which is not an issue for me at all, but I want to be thorough) I found were some of the male, teenage staff members at the prize desk by the arcade were more interested in talking to one another than initially waiting on the girls, but one of the male staff members stepped forward and took care of them w/o any attitude or problems. (I mean honestly, how many of us would want to work a prize desk at Chuck E Cheese or Caribbean Cove??). One thing to note is the lifeguards routinely have a drill (once in the evening and once at 1 PM the following day while we were there) in which they clear the pool and simulate a rescue. This took most people off guard at first, but I will admit if I had read the disclaimer upon walking into Caribbean Cove, I would have known it was coming. The only negative I did find was the side doors were unlocked as some other reviews mentioned. This is definitely a security concern, and the only reason I didn't rate the experience higher than a 4.. We didn't have any problems and I felt safe while staying there (and I was probably the only one walking in and out taking stuff to the car), but I would like to see at least a pad in which a room key could be swiped to gain entry into side doors like I've seen at most other large hotels I have stayed. Overall, it was a great time had by 4 very particular girls and a fairly well traveled mother.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for a Holiday Inn, Noisy”
Reviews.Author: TipperNC
Reviews.Content: We booked a room at the Holiday Inn Select North at the Pyramids via Site59. It was part of a package, but our room bill showed we paid only $43 per night for the hotel. Certainly worth that, especially with the free breakfast buffet they gave us for joining the HI club, but this is not the greatest hotel on earth. Do not stay here on a weekend if you don't have/adore kids. The lobby area was surprisingly nice, well decorated and themed in sort of a New Orleans street scene style. There are four restaurants here (!), which I would never expect at a Holiday Inn. We had an executive level room facing the indoor pool area. The room itself was nice, large enough with a decent bathroom and excellent water pressure in the shower. The ceilings are unusually low, but this was not a big deal. The problem with this hotel - the atrium design of the hotel ensures that the kids playing and screaming in the pool area create tremendous amounts of noise. If you need quiet to sleep prior to 11pm, do not stay in an atrium-facing room. The attached water park has what is essentially a runway linking it to the indoor hotel pool, and there was constant activity there and on the elevators - dripping, rambunctious kiddos with run-of-the-house priveleges running wild all over the place. Fun for them. The breakfast buffet was good for the price (free) and the sports bar had a decent beer list. Our final bill showed we were charged for our free breakfast (how, I don't know, since we never got a bill at the restaurant) and the desk clerk gave us a little attitude ("can you prove you had the free breakfast coupons?") but ultimately took the charge off our bill. The evening clerk made copies for us for free instead of sending us to Kinkos, which was nice. There is free internet in the lobby business center, which is supposed to be for 18yr olds and up, but there were plenty of kids checking out MySpace and whatever at all hours. Overall, a decent hotel for the price, and seems ideal if you have a pack of kids to keep entertained. I can't speak to the cleanliness of the water park as others have mentioned, but the kids we saw seemed genuinely thrilled to be there. I would not want to stay here as a business person despite some of the perks (free internet, breakfast) because the water park is just too attractive to families.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to par”
Reviews.Author: stuckinindy6
Reviews.Content: We took our 7 year old for his birthday in lew of an actual party with tons of kids. We had his 6 year old friend, our 4 and 9 years old also. Stood in line for check in from 4pm to 4:30pm. They need to do that a little better. Front desk gave me my request, for a top floor holidome balcony room. I was told the room was freshly renovated the month before. They also gave me several coupons for free kids meals at all of their restaurants and snack bars, provided one adult meal is purchased. We went up to the room, changed into our suits for the waterpark. We enjoyed the waterpark for about two hours before we stopped for dinner. We ate at Cafe St. Paul's dinner buffet. Two adults were $12 total. All of the kids ate free. About an hour after dinner, our 9 year old got very ill. He threw up all over the bathroom. He ate a dessert cheescake that the rest of us did not eat. He spent 2 hours puking, then he was fine. I called the front desk at 9:30pm to ask for housekeeping to come and clean up the mess. No one answered. I left my spouse with the kids, went all the way down to the front desk to tell them what happened. The woman said she would give housekeeping a call. She also offered to switch us to a different room for the night. I went back to the room, and started packing. The other 3 children were asleep at this point. The housekeeping man showed up shocked that no one told him what he was cleaning up. He left and said he would be back. He came back, did an okay job cleaning. He never even replaced the shower curtain. Really gross. I went back down to the front desk to get a luggage cart and our new room keys. A different lady was at the front desk. She was very rude in her manner and out right told me that there were no rooms to give out, that they were sold out. She scolded the employee who told me that before, in front of me and other staff people. We had to leave our room door and balcony door open for another 2 hours to air out the air freshner smell. Husband took 9 year old home....then to doctor the next morning. Food poisoning was confirmed. Myself and the other 3 played in the water park most of the morning, then had lunch and went home. Our newly remodeled room was a dirty mess. There were sticky finger prints on the mirrors and doors. There were gummy bears all over the carpet, stains on one of the bedsheets. The bathroom could use a string pulley to hang wet bathing suits over the tub. When the bill was placed under our door at 4am, the person knocked waking us up! Someone had also charged a $40 meal to our room. It took 30 minutes of arguing on the room phone with the hotel operator that it was not us. She finally removed the charge, but was unhappy that we didn't want to pay for someone else's meal. Next time I think we'll give into Chuck E Cheese's instead. I think that's actually cleaner than this place was.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty=Child got pink Eye at the pool”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The ONLY reason to go there is the carribean cove and it is not up to par with cleanliness no wonder my CHILD GOT THE PINK EYE Service(front desk) is SLOOOOOWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWW with long lines They have more general managers on site then they have people working at the front desk It needs an overhaul in worn out decoration Needs to be cleaner for sure Kids eat free= cheaper to eat at someplace outside the hotel for GOOD food selections especially when the place is NOT clean I would suggest a visit from the BOARD OF HEALTH soon Maybe they would look under the beds and find 2 inches of dust and dirt,EWWWWWW Do not stay there if you have allergies!

Reviews.Title: “Good spot for families with kids”
Reviews.Author: goodfoodcook
Reviews.Content: The Holiday Inn North Select Pyramids is a “good enough for what it’s for” kind of a place. With the extra special water park amenity it’s a good getaway for families with young children and maybe good for teens, but the novelty wears off quickly for them. This is a solid Holiday Inn property. It delivers the quality one would expect for a HI: nice rooms and amenities but no extra special levels of service, hospitality, amenities or décor. There are four and five stories, depending where in the property you stay, and the hotel rooms are arranged in a horseshoe pattern around the original Holidome pool area. There are exterior rooms and interior rooms facing the pool. As far as I could tell the interior rooms are larger and have two double beds. “Larger” is a relative term. It was cozy for our family of two adults and two teenagers. The exterior rooms are smaller and only have room for a single king bed as well as a reclining easy chair and a desk. (There are a handful of outside corner rooms that are appear to be the biggest. I don’t know what kinds of beds are in these.) Clothing storage includes dressers and a small alcove for Bathrooms were clean with white tile floors, hair dryers with integrated night light and coffee makers. The bath towels were thick and absorbent. The mattresses were fair but one in our room seemed to be coming to the end of its serviceable life. The four rooms I saw had wired Internet access, which is free. Ethernet cables are available from the front desk. Wireless access is available in the lobby and the Holidome. We stayed at this hotel for five days during the Easter break period. As you could guess there were lots of kids. Lots of kids. Children in bathing suits were all over the grounds despite the early spring weather: in the lobby, in the halls, and of course around the pool and water park. Appropriate to the season, there was lots of running in the hall, easily heard in our room, slamming doors and lots of loud talking the hall from both kids and parents. The ruckus quiets down quickly once the water park closes, which is 10 pm most days and 11 pm Friday and Saturday. The Holidome is a largish atrium and offers an indoor pool, as you would expect, but also offers, apparently, a staffed kids’ program with crafts. Inquire with the hotel for more details. There are also pool tables, one foosball table, one ping pong table, available for use with a fee. Family-friendly food is immediately available in the Holidome, including local chain Noble Roman’s pizza. You can eat your pizza, ice cream and soda in front of a wide screen TV. (The interior rooms facing the pool are probably noisy when the pool is busy. The exception may be the ones way off in the corners, like we had. While our view was obstructed and the light was dim it was also much quieter. You have been warned.) And now to the main attraction, Caribbean Cove, the indoor water park. It’s impressive, with three slides accessed from one interior platform. Kids climb stairs up three or four stories and choose one of three slides. One is large enough for innertubes (provided) – the other two slides are completely enclosed until you exit down below. There are three other pool areas with imaginative large interactive water spouts and fountains. The release I signed pledged me or another adult to supervise my children at all times, but several attentive lifeguards also staff the water park. Breaks are enforced every two hours. There is a third floor observation deck from which parents, relatives and others can see the park without paying for admission. There are a snack bar, a souvenir stand and a games arcade on that same observation deck. There’s also a souvenir stand on the first floor. We paid $269, plus taxes, for our daily Caribbean Cove package. That included the room and five wrist bands granting us admission to the park. The write bands will grant you admission on the day you check in and also the next day up until 3 pm. Note, however, that check-out is 11 am. There are dressing rooms in Caribbean Cove, but I don’t know how extensive they are. Was it worth it? Our younger, more innocent cousins would have played until they dropped. I think they played for a couple of hours on each of three days and played until they were exhausted. My older kids (16 and a worldly 13), however, had had plenty after two days, at about two hours each day. One can book part of a stay with the package and the rest of a stay without the package, as we did. We did have to do some silliness about checking out and checking back in when our rate changed. Finding food is not a problem at this hotel. Besides the poolside options there are three other restaurants at different price levels in the hotel. Within walking distance are a popular Texas Roadhouse and a Ruby Tuesday. Across the busy expressway are a Chinese restaurant (pretty good by Indy standards) and Bob Evans and Cracker Barrel restaurants. And a half mile away are more fast food places. If you like to eat large there’s a Costco within that same half mile. There are self-serve laundry facilities in the hotel. This consists of two stacked washer-dryer combos in an alcove off the second floor hallway. The washers are front-loading. While clean and effective, folding is a problem because there is no table or counter on which put your clean clothes. As a place to stay, sleep and eat there are better, quieter and less expensive options in the north west and north east areas of Indianapolis. However, under the right situation a trip to the Holiday Inn Caribbean Cove might be just the ticket for a very memorable family weekend getaway. Review date 4/18/2006

Reviews.Title: “Carribean Cove WaterPark- Do not Recommend!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Let's just say I would not recommend this water park to anyone. Service both on the 800 line and at the hotel reservation line was not friendly. The water park was dirty, discarded band aids, muddy puddles in the women's locker room and toilet paper strewn around everywhere. The worst was the smelly water through out the park. Our skin and swim suits reeked of water that did not have enough chlorine or chemicals in the water. The young life- guards need a class on being friendly and customer service. They portrayed attitudes and frowned like they were the most unhappy people around! Those whistles they had blew over the most ridiculous little things that I have ever seen. I really think some kids were afraid of them! (By the way I am not talking about my kids being yelled or whistled at, this is what I observed while watching my 3 year old shiver in the freezing water of the kiddie play area) Whomever manages this park better get into action and make some changes, before all his business in GONE.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced hotel + unfriendly staff + dirty water park = BAD”
Reviews.Author: JCE72
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 3 day / 2 night stay. I'll break the review into two parts; Water Park & Hotel. Water Park – Floor pools were dirty and had objects floating on the bottom, such as, wadded up Kleenex. Long lines for the slides; there was only one life guard playing traffic cop at the top of the slides hence the back-up of people and long lines. The hot tubs are grimy and foul. Water had a salty overtone to it. Overall, the pools are/were polluted and did not have that pool chlorine smell or taste to them. On the plus side, there are a variety of water activities for all ages and plenty of life guards on duty. If you must, I would spend no more then one day at this place, just be cautious. Hotel – Although the hotel is claiming to be renovated, it is very slumber worn and fraying at the edges. Items such as, cracked tiles, small bathrooms, low ceilings, worn carpet, thin & tattered towels, and little things like closet doors not closing. The staff at check-in are not friendly or helpful. One of the ladies was wearing a "do-rag" – hardly knew she worked there other then she barked "Next!" with out looking up at the exhausted travelers in a comatose from the long wait times at check-in. This is just the tip of the iceberg about the hotel. Email me if you want more details. Bottom line for the water park & hotel is that there are better ways for you to part with your hard earned money. I regret that I spent mine with Holiday Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Birthday for 2 grandson's”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was a owesome birthay for our grandson's. The staff were excellent and careing. This was a very clean Holiday Inn. Great visit will return next year and a few after that.

HotelInfo.Name: Caribbean Cove Hotel & Conference Center
HotelInfo.Address: 3850 DePauw Blvd, Indianapolis, IN 46268 (Formerly Holiday Inn Select Indianapolis North (At The Pyramids))
